intro: Verbascum rolletianum, commonly known as the mountain mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which includes several species of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Verbascum rolletianum is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
